item.title: Normal Distribution
item.description: Definition A continuous probability distribution $N \left( \mu,\sigma^{2} \right)$ with a probability density function as follows, given mean $\mu \in \mathbb{R}$ and variance $\sigma^{2} > 0$, is called Normal Distribution. $$ f(x) = {{ 1 } \over { \sqrt{2 \pi} \sigma }} \exp \left[ - {{ 1 } \over { 2 }} \left( {{ x - \mu } \over { \sigma }} \right)^{2} \right] \qquad, x \in \mathbb{R} $$ In
